description: I am a historian, improv comedian, and infrastructure obsessive. Growing up, I didn't think much about my city—Torontonians tend not to boast about their city. But I've realized this place is far more than meets the eye: Toronto is a vast network of buried waterways, ancient cliffs, the world's largest ravine system, and centuries of waterfront transformation. This history is rarely shared shown to tourists, and is unknown to many locals. I want to show you what makes Toronto extraordinary.

reviews.title: Fun, laid back experience
text: My childhood, next door neighbor lives in Hamilton. We were in Toronto for vacation  and we decided to meet up at this tour. It is a short hike with lots of information. Having never been to Hamilton before it was a really pretty hike with tree coverage for 90% of the hike. It’s a good hike for all levels.

reviews.title: Insightful Sunday!
text: I had heard of Hidden rivers by my friends who had gone on separate tours and they came highly recommended. Needless to say my cousin & I  weren’t disappointed as Matthew was very knowledgeable who kept sharing historical facts throughout our tour with a lot of passion for the subject tied in with humour and encouragement to also socialise with fellow travellers. Surely do one of their trips if you want to see the city through a very different lens that is going to leave you curious to observe the city and it’s surroundings. Be ready to walk A LOT but it will be worth it I promise.

reviews.title: You want to know more than most guide books then join Mathew on his walking tours every summer
text: Mathew clearly loves his city to want to know more than what is obvious. Walking with him means going back in time, not just hundreds of years but also recent history like Bay subway station (on Bloor that everyone coming to Toronto will visit at least once) has two levels, the lower now permanently closed and all you get is a peek through closed doors unless you are part of a film crew, or guest at a wedding or rave because it can be rented, the only condition being you must have very deep billionaire pockets.

reviews.title: Why didn't I do this before?
text: Honestly, this tour was amazing! I learned so much about my city that I never knew before. I felt like I connected with it, the geography, history and people in a completely new way. A huge thank you to Matthew for organizing and leading this tour!

reviews.title: Walking tour of Don Valley ecosystem
text: A very fun and educational walk and discussion with our guide Matthew at Hidden Rivers. Learned about the history and ecology of the Don Valley. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: 10/10! You gotta go
text: Absolutely loved it! Matthew is an amazing host and created a sense of community with all the guests. 10/10 I'm def going back for the next one

reviews.title: Learn history in a fun, amusing way while getting your steps in!
text: I was worried about a 3h tour!  But Matthew is such a charismatic and animated guide!  He makes you WANT to learn more about the fascinating hisotry of our wonderful city.  I am so glad that we went.

reviews.title: Not your average tour guide.
text: I've done two of Matthew's walking tours around Toronto and thoroughly enjoyed them.  Matthew is super upbeat and has a plethora of information and fun facts about the city of Toronto.  If you enjoy walking, meeting new people, and soaking up some new information about this amazing city we live in, I highly recommend Matthew's tours.

reviews.title: Great tour
text: Fabulous tour. I've lived in Toronto all my life and have never walked through the ravine and experienced Toronto that way.
Your enthusiasm for what you do makes the walk that much more special!

reviews.title: Explore your city from an entirely different lense
text: Matthew was our tour guide on The City Beneath Toronto tour. He is an amazing tour guide - anyone can start a tour company, few can be truly be passionate about Toronto (and it's rivers and ravines) in the way Matthew is. I would probably keep an eye on his website and take more tours this summer and in the future!

reviews.title: More appreciation for TO <3
text: Matthew was such an enthusiastic guide and had a vast historical knowledge of Toronto. We went over 3 hours but he kept us engaged and entertained. I really enjoyed the unique pockets of Toronto and the little Tollkeeper's Cottage. There are a lot of interesting places in the city if you know where to look.

reviews.title: Excellent, out of the ordinary tour
text: A fascinating, informative and at times scenic tour, enhanced by the knowledge, enthusiasm and humour of Matthew, the guide

reviews.title: All my steps were transcendent!
text: This experience transformed my view of Toronto as the big noisy scary city. Instead we were taken to beautiful natural spaces, hidden away from view but RIGHT THERE to transport you to a world of forests, meadows, and yes…hidden rivers. Matthew is one of the engaging guides I have ever experienced…and I’m 62! Plus…got in all my steps as a bonus:)

reviews.title: The best tour
text: I had no idea that Toronto had so much history and to walk through these places as we learn was an eye opening experience and an absolute pleasure.
Matthew Jordan is amazing at what he does.

reviews.title: I had the best time!
text: Such a fun, enjoyable, and informative tour. It truly is for everyone in the city, (or even not from the city!), and Matthew is a great tour guide. There is so much to learn about Toronto and this tour teaches you just that while being  a fun, engaging, experience. I truly cannot recommend it enough :)

reviews.title: See Toronto in a Brand New Light
text: Very interesting tour and Matthew is such a natural communicator. He brought just the right amount of depth and context at each stop on the tour.
Both his tours and resources post-tour really helped me better appreciate the city I call home!
Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Great walking tour with a unique perspective of Toronto
text: Excellent experience. Matthew is an enthusiastic guide who provides an eye-opening perspective about Toronto. My friend and I had a great time, even with a big group. Matthew ensured that the group stuck together and got to know each other.
Get ready for a good walk (about 3-4km), and bring some water/snacks! This tour is about 3 hours, depending on the size of the group.
Highly recommend to locals and visitors alike to learn about the geological, ecological, and human history within the city.

reviews.title: Incredible tour
text: When I first moved to Toronto, I always described it as a place with no history and this stayed true until I got to attend this tour with Matthew. Nature is a such a big part of our past and this tour is able to explain so much about how Toronto and the GTA came to be. Thanks Matthew for everything!

reviews.title: Best Walking Tour Experience So Far in Toronto
text: One of the best tours that I have in Toronto. Highly recommended. It was such a unique tour that I had the experience so far plus tour guide is very knowledgeable with a kind heart.

reviews.title: Great local tour of the city
text: I had seen TikToks if this tour and was curious to attend one on my own. The tour was great and the tour guide was so friendly, enthusiastic and knowledgeable. I would definitely attend another one. The pace was steady with lots of shady rest stops along the way. He kept us all engaged and organized and despite being a bigger group that normal, the tour moved well. Really friendly group and guide. 10 out of 10!

reviews.title: Phenomenal walk through Toronto
text: Matthew is a fantastic tour guide. He was very informative and personable and we all really enjoyed the tour of Toronto Beneath the Surface. Unanimously, everyone on the tour wanted his contact information to book future tours.

reviews.title: Fun and educational…it’s a must!
text: This is an exceptional walking tour and Matthew is outstanding! Despite having grown up in Toronto, I learned so much. I have a new appreciation for our “city within a park”.
I’ve been on numerous tours in other cities and this tour stood out with its unique insights and Matthew’s engaging stories.
I HIGHLY recommend this tour to everyone—fun anecdotes educational!

reviews.title: Great tour
text: Matthew was a great tour guide! He bravely faced the rain when our group was determined to go out (even with the inclement weather). He had a good balance of telling us facts about Toronto and answering our many questions about geology and history. I would recommend this tour to anyone who has lived in this city for a short or long time!

reviews.title: An amazing walking tour in Toronto
text: We learnt so much more about the history of Toronto, Canada, and, frankly, the planet! Matt is an amazing guide and very passionate about sharing his knowledge with others. Would go on the same tour again, and would like to attend other tours provided by him as well! 100% recommend.

reviews.title: Worth attending, you can tell Matt really loved sharing this
text: The time spent was well enjoyed. Learning more about the city and its history, how the past gives clues to it’s existence in the present, and how both are intertwined marvellously with the storytelling by Matty during the 3 hour excursion. It was truly a joy, it felt like a newly discovered community.

reviews.title: A scenic walking tour of Toronto to see the city from a brand new perspective!
text: What a great Walking Tour with Matthew, "The Hidden River Tours" is a must, whether you live in Toronto or are visiting the city we call home!  You will learn a ton of amazing, historical facts dating back 1,000s of years about our city!  Take this tour & learn about what built Toronto & the hidden gems that are right below our feet.
Matthew is an excellent presenter... knowledgeable, entertaining and witty!

reviews.title: exploring the hidden Garrison Creek
text: I really enjoyed the entire experience! Guide Matthew was very knowledgeable and provided clear explanations, responding thoughtfully to all our questions. His passion for the city and nature was evident in his commentary. It was a fun day spent on a waterfront walk in Toronto with colleagues. I especially enjoyed exploring the hidden Garrison Creek, buried beneath the streets and bridges.

reviews.title: Exceptional experience!
text: What an exceptional experience walking with Matthew! I’ve lived in Toronto my whole life and have done many, many walking tours in this city but still learned an absolute ton from him. If you live here, you must take this tour to learn about what built Toronto and the hidden geological gems right under our feet. If you’re visiting, this is a great, off the beaten path tour to learn more about this city and its history and present. Matthew has an excellent presentation that makes you feel like you’re in a classroom, in the best possible way. Loved it!

reviews.title: Super awesome.
text: Very awesome tour, I was nervous to  show up by myself but Matthew did a great job at helping your participants befriend each other. He is full of fun facts. 10/10, I’ll be going on many of the other tours in the future.

reviews.title: Awesome
text: Very unique tour and knowledgeable and enthusiastic guide (Matty) who truly loves his city and has "uncovered" a new perspective on the city we all love but dont know!

reviews.title: A Must Do!
text: Matthew is a knowledgeable, passionate, and engaging tour guide! I feel like I learned a lot, and it was good exercise! This is one of my favourite things I’ve done in Toronto in the 3 years I’ve lived in the city. Would recommend this tour! Especially good for solo travellers! 10/10

reviews.title: Toronto Beneath the Surface
text: Matthew gave an amazing tour of the city filled with cool facts, great viewpoints, and fun conversation! Can’t wait to book another one!

reviews.title: Both education while being entertaining, a lovely experience all around
text: This was one of the best things I could've been doing on a Thursday morning! Matthew is excellent at providing wonderful educational bits on the history of Toronto and it's underground ravine system - I not only learned a lot but had a ton of fun, as well as walked out with some new friends. I got to see parts of Toronto I didn't even know existed, and it was truly a beautiful experience that made me appreciate the city that much more.  Everyone was also incredibly sweet, and there were so many wonderful surprises on the walk that made it that much more special (freezies from his grandma's house, bumping into friends and neighbours, an exclusive experience at a historical building). Highly recommend for anyone whether new to the city or a longterm resident!

reviews.title: You gotta do it!!
text: One of the best things you can do to understand the city, as a local or visitor! Stellar tour guide, will have you seeing the city in a whole new light.

reviews.title: So much fun!
text: Matthew's tours are incredible for anyone who loves to learn about their city. Everyone on the tour had an unforgettable experience!

reviews.title: Wonderful tours by an incredible individual.
text: Matthew is a welcome addition to the Toronto walking tour scene.  He is such an interesting, charismatic, energetic, fun person and he knows more about Toronto than anyone I have ever met. His tours are well-researched and fascinating. For anyone looking for a fun way to spend a few hours, and to learn more about Toronto than just the typical tourist sights, these tours are a must.

reviews.title: Not your typical touristy tour in all the best ways!
text: This is not your typical touristy tour! I did the "Where's the Waterfront?" tour which dives into the evolution of Toronto's changing waterfront over time as the city has 'reclaimed' land from the lake. Matt is incredibly passionate, vibrant and enthusiastic. I expected it to be a special tour given Matt has independently studied the city out of his own personal interest and developed these tours from scratch -- and he lived up to and even surpassed those high expectations! This isn't a person studying someone else's curriculum and rotely repeating it just to make a buck! As a local fascinated by the details of the city, I'm looking forward to attending Matt's full slate of tours this summer.

reviews.title: Don’t miss it! Tour now
text: Matthew is a remarkable and energetic guide of the city. He possesses a unique knowledge across a broad array of topics. The group was fun and eclectic and the tour was both riveting and hilarious. Highly, highly recommended.

reviews.title: Hidden gems and hidden rivers !
text: Brilliant walk with Matthew - so much interesting information about Toronto and I really felt it was a unique experience as the detail and research was  depth and engaging.

reviews.title: Great guide with a passion for the city
text: Wonderful guide, interesting content, and a nice way to get to know the city. Matthew clearly has a passion for the various wide-ranging topics he covers and his enthusiasm is infectious!
